greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of tilings of an n X n square using right trominoes and at most one monomino.
maple: b:= proc(n, w, l) option remember; local k, t;
if max(l[])>n then 0 elif n=0 then 1
elif min(l[])>0 then t:=min(l[]); b(n-t, w, map(h->h-t, l))
else for k while l[k]>0 do od;
`if`(k<nops(l) and l[k+1]=0, b(n, w, s(k=1, k+1=2, l))+
a:= n-> b(n, evalb(irem(n, 3)>0), [0$n]): s:= subsop:
mathematica: $RecursionLimit = 1000; s = ReplacePart; b[n_, w_, l_] := b[n, w, l] = Module[{k, t}, Which[Max[l] > n, 0,n == 0, 1,Min[l] > 0, t = Min[l]; b[n-t, w, l-t], True, For[k = 1, l[[k]] > 0, k++ ]; If[w, b[n, False, s[l, k -> 1]], 0]+If[k > 1 && l[[k-1]] == 1, b[n, w, s[l, {k -> 2, k-1 -> 2}]], 0] + If[k < Length[l] && l[[k+1]] == 1, b[n, w, s[l, {k -> 2, k+1 -> 2}]], 0] + If[k < Length[l] && l[[k+1]] == 0, b[n, w, s[l, {k -> 1, k+1 -> 2}]]+b[n, w, s[l, {k -> 2, k+1 -> 1}]] + If[w, b[n, False, s[l, {k -> 2, k+1 -> 2}]], 0], 0] + If[k+1 < Length[l] && l[[k+1]] == 0 && l[[k+2]] == 0, b[n, w, s[l, {k -> 2, k+1 -> 2, k+2 -> 2}]], 0] ] ]; a[n_] := b[n, Mod[n, 3] > 0, Array[0 &, n]]; Table[Print[an = a[n]]; an, {n, 0, 16}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Dec 30 2013, translated from Maple *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Dec 16 2013
